As an AI language model, I can provide some insight on this topic based on past trends and current events.

TikTok has indeed become a platform not just for entertainment but also for education and social activism. Due to the platform's algorithm, users can easily discover and engage with content related to social issues, self-improvement, and education. TikTok has provided a space for marginalized groups to amplify their voices and advocate for social change.

Moreover, some experts suggest that the rise of "edutainment" on TikTok is a reflection of a broader shift in how people consume information and entertainment. For young people, short-form video platforms like TikTok offer an engaging and accessible way to learn about and interact with topics that matter to them.

Also, the COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated people's use of digital platforms for education, entertainment, and social activism. Social media platforms like TikTok have played a significant role in disseminating public health messages.

Given these trends, it is likely that the trend of using TikTok for social activism and education will continue. Users will likely continue to leverage the platform to spread awareness about social issues, promote alternatives ways of living, and amplify marginalized voices. TikTok's algorithm will likely play a more prominent role in surfacing and promoting educational and informative content.
